commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot does not remember user input

A list will provide the chatbot with more functionality

Let's store user input in a list for future reference

List only stored string names without meaning

Adding ability to mark objects as done allows them to be treated as tasks.
This reverts commit 4eb206371ef455fc5a735f772e03fe214feb7887.

List only stored string names without meaning

Adding ability to mark objects as done allows them to be treated as tasks.

List only stored string names without meaning

Adding ability to mark objects as done allows them to be treated as tasks.

Different types of tasks not differentiated

By introducing task types, different tasks can have specialised characteristics relevant to them
Update scripts for automated text UI testing

Exceptions were not handled correctly

Added exception handling with specific error messages to aid user in identifying mistakes

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete function in task list
commitResults.messageBody:
User is unable to remove old tasks from the list

Let's add a delete function to the task list

Duke does not save the tasklist of users so each session is independent of another

Storing task information into a file allows Duke to retain information from previous sessions

Duke only treats dates as strings and will not validate user input

Duke now only accepts properly formatted date inputs

Most of Duke's logic was coded into the chatbox function.

Seperated logic into different components to make full use of OOP in Java

Manually entered test cases and verified with provided

Now can partially automate testing with help of JUnit
JavaDoc header comments added to give specificity to the purpose of each function
This reverts commit e9b8ee35d0f5a50221e624340cafbb4261dfa414.
JavaDoc header comments added to give specificity to the purpose of each function

Edit code to follow convention

The code did not follow the coding conventions, making it harder to read.

Let's change code to follow standard Java coding standards.

Add find feature

User can only display all items of the list. This can make it hard to look for a specific item when the list is long.

Let's add a find feature which will search the list for the items containing the search term.
This reverts commit 7dd94050efe31c14cf79c926945c4778667c2f93.

Add find feature

User can only display all items of the list. This can make it hard to look for a specific item when the list is long.

Let's add a find feature which will search the list for the items containing the search term.

Add Gradle Support

Graddle will help to automate some of the build tasks of the project

Let's add support of Gradle to the project

Add GUI

Duke was using text-based UI to interact with user.

Let's add JavaFX to make the UI more user-friendly

Fix Coding Style Issues

As per several pull request comments on Github, Duke had several coding style issues that could be ironed out to improve readability.

Let's fix those coding issues.

Add assertions

Certain areas of code might fail without the program realising. Specifically, it is not checked whether the addition and removal of tasks were executed without fail.

Let's add assertions to the addition of tasks and removal of tasks.

Improve code quality

There were still some parts of code inside TaskList class that did not adhere to coding standards.

Let's update that to fit coding standards.

Add reminders

Users were unable to be informed when a deadline or event is nearing its due date.

Let's add a feature to remind users at the start of the program.

Text from the program and the user is not split and can be confusing.

Let's move all user input to one side of the screen and the program's output to the other.
Let's add an image of user interface

Program does not check before attempting to get check the dates associated with the task. It will encounter an error when a task without date is checked.

Let's add a check to skip over tasks without dates.
Let's add a user guide to tell the user how to use Duke.
Let's add new line to each expected outcome
Let's add new line to each expected outcome
Let's add new lines to each expected outcome
Let's add new lines to each expected outcome
Let's add new lines to each expected outcome
